title: Toronto NSW: Police officers stabbed as shots fired at man with knives
text:
Are you in sticky situation with the law? Or have you suddenly found yourself on the other side of the thin blue line? Whether you are guilty or not, here's what to expect when you are facing criminal proceedings.

What happens when you are charged with a crime?

Two police officers have suffered stab wounds and “a number of shots” have been discharged at a man reportedly wielding two knives.

NSW Police said officers were called to a service station at the major intersection of The Boulevarde and Carey St in Toronto, in the Lake Macquarie region, shortly before 1pm today.

BREAKING | A police operation is underway at #Toronto in Lake Macquarie. A man armed with a knife has been detained by officers. Public advised to avoid the area. More details as they come @9NewsSyd @nbnnews — Georgia Anderson (@GAndersonNews) October 6, 2019

Police arrived and were confronted with a man who was allegedly armed with two knives.

“A number of shots were discharged by police; however, the man was uninjured, and two officers suffered stab wounds — one to leg and the other to the hand,” police said.

“Both have been taken to John Hunter Hospital in a stable condition and will undergo surgery.”

The 25-year-old male suspect was arrested and taken to Toronto police station.

Multiple crime scenes were established and the intersection was closed as inquiries continue.

The Daily Telegraph reported the man was spotted by a group of men who were on a bus heading to perform court-ordered community service.

One of the witnesses said the officers did not have Tasers and used a baton to attempt to disarm the man before he allegedly stabbed one officer in the thigh and the other in the hand.

He said they fired their guns and the man dropped what he was holding before he was held down and arrested.
description: Two police officers have suffered stab wounds and “a number of shots” have been discharged at a man reportedly wielding two knives.
